meanings.definition: Relating to or controlled by a single gene.
meanings.sent1: The doctor explained that the child's condition was monogenic, meaning it was caused by just one gene.
meanings.sent2: The scientist studied the monogenic trait that determined eye color in the fruit flies.
meanings.sent3: It was quite monogenic how the flower's color was solely determined by a single gene.
meanings.sent4: The impact of that one decision was monogenic, affecting the entire project.
meanings.sent5: The monogenic nature of the disease made it easier to trace back to its genetic origin.
